data.title: Cannot compete with similar Mexican chain restaurants
data.text:
All around disappointing entrees for each of us.  Salsa bar offers limited options.  Yes, the ingredients are fresh, but the dishes just don't come together.  And for the price paid, they should be doing a better job.

First, you order at the counter and then get a number when your order is ready.  So this restaurant concept is similar to many others in south Florida.

I ordered the chicken fajitas.  I meant to ask for corn tortillas instead of flour, but I forgot.  I wasn't asked which I wanted.  The chicken was grilled to perfection and served on a hot platter over sautéed onions and red peppers.  They came with small condiments of guacamole, sour cream, and salsa.  Unfortunately, each of these condiments were placed on top of mostly lettuce so there was not enough to make even three fajitas.  

The Monterrey Mix was primarily a very large burrito served with fried plantains, and a couple other fried items.  The plantains were greasy and leaked across the bottom of the plate, and the burrito was too salty to be edible.

The steak enchiladas were mediocre at best, as if the steak had been prepared well before hand.  They came with black beans and rice.

Lunch for three of us (only one soda, two waters) came to $41.65.

No reason for us to return.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Propietario at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Layne, we're so sorry to hear about your experience. Our food is made daily from scratch in premises to keep its freshness. We value our costumers opinion a lot, and want to thank you for taking the time to write us. We will take the necessary measures to improve.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Friday night fiesta
data.text: This was my first time visiting this restaurant with the fam, we decided to give it a try because we received a coupon in the mail and it is reasonably priced. This restaurant is a mix between taco craft and lime as far as atmosphere goes, it is in the line of fast casual restaurants. We all ordered tacos, and they were very delicious! They have a limited selection of tacos but you can choose what type of meat you would like so there are plenty of options, the tacos were delicious and unique, not anything I've had anywhere else! Try the one with mango in it! Also, they were a decent size, and kinda messy (if you don't have the right technique). They have flour and corn tortillas. They had a salsa bar but we didn't sample too much because we ordered two dips with our food. Sorry to say but the guacamole could use some work. Not the best. Otherwise we enjoyed it!

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Propietario at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Caroline, thanks for your feedback! We're glad to hear you enjoyed our food and had a great time at our place. Our food is made daily from scratch in premises to keep its freshness. Next time don't miss our Mayan Roll dessert, the perfect combination between chocolate, dulce de leche and whip cream, YUMM!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Quick Place for Mexican food
data.text:
If your are in search of a fun quick meal this is the spot. It's in a good location for downtown Fort Lauderdale. The staff are super nice and helpful.

They have a vast choice of menu options. It's decorated very nice and its easy going.

They have a delicious salsa bar to add flavor to your meal.

Only reason for a 4 is I wish they had a hot sauce selection but they pretty much only have salsa but you can't blame them since the place is called salsa fiesta.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Propietario at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Aaron B, thanks for your feedback. We are so glad to hear that you had a great time and enjoyed our food. Next time you come by try the spicy "lava cabbage" sauce at the salsa bar, but if you are looking for something very spicy ask us for the “mucho caliente” sauce, Its our made in house hot sauce that we have available by request is made daily using roasted habaneros. We don’t have any bottled hot sauces because we believed in fresh and made in house products only. Hope to see you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Venezuelans make Mexican
data.text: This Venezuelan owned chain actually does a decent job at making fast food Mexican. We've sampled the board and it is all pretty good. I really enjoy the kids meals as they are not too big and healthy compared to 99% of other fast food choices! Who can say no to black beans?! For the adults, there are several quality beers to choose from and margaritas for those Friday afternoons! Cheers!

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Propietario at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi gammish, thanks for your feedback. We're glad to hear you enjoyed the ultimate 5 star Salsa Fiesta experience. We're a family owned restaurant, and our costumers happiness is our priority. Hope you visit us again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food before the concert
data.text:
We were looking for a place to eat before a concert. We didn't want hamburgers so this came up. Nice Mexican food, nice service. You can try the salsas, different and interesting flavors. We love it!
Really good fast food

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Propietario at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello energizegirl, thanks for your feedback. Our food is made daily from scratch in premises to keep its freshness, and we're all about keeping our costumers happy. Hope you visit us again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Surprised
data.text:
I've just finished my first meal here, and I was really pleasantly surprised.

I left California a few years ago, and finding food like this here has been tough.

But, the chicken fajita was excellent--the meat was juicy, the guac and vegetables very fresh.

I will be back.  Again and again and again

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Gerente at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thank you for your feedback! We're so glad to hear you had the 5 star Salsa Fiesta experience you deserve! We definitely work hard on giving our costumers a great service and delicious food, which is made daily from scratch in premises to keep its freshness. We hope to see you again!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Staff didn't show up
data.text:
We arrived 45 mins after opening and the only people working were the young woman manager and a young guy in the back. The rest of the staff no showed. The manager handled the situation like a pro. We would of left if it wasn't for her. Whoever runs this place, keep her around as long as you can. 

The food was great and even tho we had to wait awhile, would definitely come back

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Gerente at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thank you for your feedback. We are really sorry about the inconvenience, but glad to know that our manager handled the situation so well. Our food is made daily from scratch in premises to keep it's freshness, and making our costumers happy is what we're all about. We hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious, Light, Fresh
data.text: My friend and I went for an early dinner. We got a ceviche to share. It was light and fresh. I had a Santa Fe burrito bowl. Once again ingredients were fresh.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Gerente at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thank you for your feedback! Our food is made daily from scratch in premises to keep its freshness, and we are glad you noticed it on the taste of the food. We hope to have you both again at our place!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Chipotle-esque Quick Stop
data.text: We stopped in for lunch here before departing Ft. Lauderdale. We hadn't had any Mexican food yet while down there and this restaurant didn't disappoint. It had a Chipotle feel to it and the food was superb. My chicken quesadilla was large but not to the point that I was regretting eating it. It was the perfect lunch time stop. We would definitely stop in again.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Gerente at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thank you for yout feedback! We are really glad to hear that you enjoyed our quesadillas! If you love cheese, next time you should try our cheese taquitos, theyre the best!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Delicious unique mexican food
data.text: My husband and I went after work with a Groupon.  We ordered the Crushed Chili dip with chips as an appetizer - it was really good.   My entree was the spicy tangy tacos and my husband ordered enchiladas.  We really enjoyed our meals.  It was very slow that evening, so we were served at our table and had excellent service.  I also ordered a margarita which was one of the best margaritas I've had. Overall, very delicious and would definitely recommend.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Gerente at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thank you so much for your feedback! We are really glad to hear that you enjoyed our food. Enchiladas and Tacos are really popular among our clients for its taste. Next time we recommend you to share with your husband our Mayan Roll dessert! Two chocolate filled crispy flour tortillas with whipped cream & dulce de leche.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food
data.text: Service good, food good, very relaxing. Must stop in and give it a try!!! Will definitely be back again soon.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Gerente at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello! Thank you so much for your feedback. We are really glad to hear that you had a 5 star Salsa Fiesta Experience, and we hope to see you again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Surpriseingly good for fast food.
data.text: Nice extensive menu.  Got takeout.  Was not ready when promised, but server apologized for delay.  Food was very good.  Portions were large.  Much better than I expected.

data.title: Great Food, service needs improvement
data.text:
I have been visiting Fort Lauderdale for the past 3 years, usually in November. I would stayed for 1 day prior to my cruise. I love to eat at this place.

Price is reasonable,   great variety and fresh.

Service - not impressive:
My recent visit in Nov 2015, the waiter had knocked down the beer bottle which my husband was having and he did not offer to replace it and actually charged us full price for it. For his carelessness, points deducted! Also, there was another table where one of the waitress' friends and families were there. She had no interests in serving anyone else but that table and keep going back to chat and shared their food then walked back to the kitchen again. Maybe she is the owner, I don't know. Again, not great.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Owner at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Joria,
Thank you for taking the time out to share your experience with us. At Salsa Fiesta, we strive to provide the best experience for our guests and want you to know we take these reviews very seriously in order to find ways to improve. We apologize for your recent visit to Salsa Fiesta look forward to the opportunity to earning your fifth star review.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great food, amazingly fast service!
data.text: Great food, awesome service in the blink of an eye!! Great place to eat and delicious margaritas!! Our server knew we were catching a flight and in a hurry, our food was here before we barely order!

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Owner at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Chris,
Thanks for taking the time out to share your five star experience with us. We're glad to hear that you enjoyed our delicious margaritas and speedy service. We look forward to serving you soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great if you are not a real Mexican
data.text: Typical fake Mexican food, but tasty.  The staff were welcoming, professional and friendly.  Lots of rice filler in the food and salsa not very hot.  Atmosphere of the interior was hip and clean.

data.title: Good Tacos
data.text: The salsas here are definitely great, tacos are pretty good. The service seems to be confused about their own menu every time I've been, but they're nice enough.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Manager at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Jaydie, thank you for the great review! We're glad you enjoy our salsas and tacos! As a small family business, we strive to provide the best food and service for our customers and are happy to see we're doing just that! We look forward towards your next visit.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Meh.  Doesn't measure up to the reviews.
data.text: Nearly impossible to find a parking spot during weekday lunch. There are 3 or 4 other restaurants in this small strip in the downtown business area. Finally found one and got lucky. Only one person in line. ( by the time I left ten minutes later they were a dozen deep). OK, the food was fresh, I'll give it that. I had two beef tacos with guac and pico de galo. The soft corn tortillas were the only highlight. EVERYTHING else lacked seasoning. Even the tortilla chips were land with little or no salt. Same with the guac. There was no hot salsa and the medium was well short of medium, and did I mention no salt?

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Manager at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello, thank you for the review. We strive to provide the best experience for our guests and want you to know we take these reviews very seriously in order to find ways to improve. We apologize for your recent visit to Salsa Fiesta and hope you can give us a second chance in the near future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fresh Food
data.text: I love this place as a local. The food is always fresh and tasty. The guacamole and pico are great and the self-help salsa bar has a variety of extras for whatever you are looking for, my favorite being the spicy purple cabbage and fresh jalapenos. They have some of the best tostones and my boyfriend loves the carnitas quesadillas.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Manager at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Melanie, we're happy to hear you enjoy the guacamole and pico at Salsa Fiesta. We always strive to provide the freshest ingredients and the tastiest food, and are glad to read you think so too! We look forward to serving you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good food
data.text: The food is awesome and the staff is very friendly if you want good cuban/Mexican food go here and the prices are good too

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Manager at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hi Manuel, we are delighted that you enjoyed your food at Salsa Fiesta and that you received great service from our staff. We look forward to serving you again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Good, Fast Mexican
data.text:
This is a good spot for a Mexican meal. The food is tasty, the service is good and the facility is clean with a very casual atmosphere. The prices are very reasonable making this place a good bargain.

I had never heard of this place before and subsequently found out that they have a half-dozen or so locations in South Florida with a handful of shops in Venezuela as well. There have been a number of these types of places that have cropped up over the past few years in the mold of Q-Doba and Chipotle. They characterize their style as contemporary urban Mexican and they hit their mark pretty well from what I could see.

I came in on a Wednesday for lunch and it was fairly busy suggesting it was not a secret for the locals. The location in a small strip plaza, away from the tourist area on Hwy 1, was in the middle of a plethora of commercial establishments that catered more to Ft. Lauderdale residents. The format was walk-up-and-order. The person who took my order was very personable, knowledgeable and efficient. The interior seating area was reasonably spacious and had a combination of low and elevated tables providing a nice spot to enjoy a meal. I opted for the Santa Fe Burrito in a bowl. I always appreciate it when these tortilla-free options are available. I also appreciated the fact that they had bottled Pellegrino as a beverage option. I was happy with my selection as the burrito bowl was pretty tasty.

The prices were quite reasonable as my burrito bowl was $8.99. My total bill with tax and a small tip was $15.00. This was fairly reasonable for what I got.

Overall, if you are looking for a casual Mexican meal, especially at lunch time, this is a good bet. The food is tasty, the service is excellent and the atmosphere is light and casual with appropriately themed decor. The prices are quite reasonable for the product. I would not hesitate to recommend this spot if you are in the area.

owner_response.author: Samuel P, Owner at Salsa Fiesta, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Debbie, We truly appreciate you sharing your feedback with us. We're happy to hear you loved the burrito bowl and our service. We always aim for every guest to leave fully satisfied. We look forward to serving you again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
